#!/usr/bin/env fish
# Utility functions for project scaffolding tool

# Color output functions
function print_info
    set_color blue
    echo -n "‚Ñπ "
    set_color normal
    echo $argv
end

function print_success
    set_color green
    echo -n "‚úì "
    set_color normal
    echo $argv
end

function print_error
    set_color red
    echo -n "‚úó "
    set_color normal
    echo $argv >&2
end

function print_warning
    set_color yellow
    echo -n "‚ö† "
    set_color normal
    echo $argv
end

# Check if command exists
function command_exists
    command -v $argv[1] >/dev/null 2>&1
end

# Create directory with parent directories
function ensure_dir
    set -l dir $argv[1]
    if not test -d $dir
        mkdir -p $dir
        and print_success "Created directory: $dir"
    end
end

# Safe file creation with backup
function safe_write
    set -l file $argv[1]
    set -l content $argv[2]
    
    if test -f $file
        set -l backup $file.backup.(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)
        cp $file $backup
        print_warning "Backed up existing file to: $backup"
    end
    
    echo $content > $file
    and print_success "Created file: $file"
end

# Get user input with prompt
function prompt_input
    set -l prompt $argv[1]
    set -l default $argv[2]
    
    if test -n "$default"
        read -P "$prompt [$default]: " input
        if test -z "$input"
            echo $default
        else
            echo $input
        end
    else
        read -P "$prompt: " input
        echo $input
    end
end

# Validate project name
function validate_project_name
    set -l name $argv[1]
    
    # Check if empty
    if test -z "$name"
        print_error "Project name cannot be empty"
        return 1
    end
    
    # Check for valid characters (alphanumeric, dash, underscore)
    if not string match -qr '^[a-zA-Z0-9_-]+$' $name
        print_error "Project name can only contain letters, numbers, dashes, and underscores"
        return 1
    end
    
    # Check if directory already exists
    if test -d $name
        print_error "Directory '$name' already exists"
        return 1
    end
    
    return 0
end

# Format file size
function format_size
    set -l size $argv[1]
    set -l units B KB MB GB TB
    set -l unit_index 1
    
    while test $size -gt 1024; and test $unit_index -lt (count $units)
        set size (math -s2 $size / 1024)
        set unit_index (math $unit_index + 1)
    end
    
    echo $size$units[$unit_index]
end

# Execute command with spinner
function run_with_spinner
    set -l cmd $argv
    set -l spin_chars '‚†ã' '‚†ô' '‚†π' '‚†∏' '‚†º' '‚†¥' '‚†¶' '‚†ß' '‚†á' '‚†è'
    set -l pid
    
    # Start command in background
    fish -c "$cmd" &
    set pid $last_pid
    
    # Show spinner while command runs
    set -l i 1
    while kill -0 $pid 2>/dev/null
        printf "\r%s " $spin_chars[$i]
        set i (math "($i % (count $spin_chars)) + 1")
        sleep 0.1
    end
    
    # Clear spinner
    printf "\r  \r"
    
    # Get exit status
    wait $pid
    return $status
end

# List to string with separator
function join_list
    set -l separator $argv[1]
    set -l items $argv[2..-1]
    
    string join $separator $items
end

# Check if list contains item
function list_contains
    set -l needle $argv[1]
    set -l haystack $argv[2..-1]
    
    contains $needle $haystack
end

# Get script directory (Fish equivalent of dirname)
function get_script_dir
    set -l source (status --current-filename)
    if test -n "$source"
        dirname $source
    else
        pwd
    end
end

# Simple JSON-like key-value storage
function kv_set
    set -l store $argv[1]
    set -l key $argv[2]
    set -l value $argv[3]
    
    set -g $store"_"$key $value
end

function kv_get
    set -l store $argv[1]
    set -l key $argv[2]
    
    eval echo \$$store"_"$key
end

# Progress bar
function show_progress
    set -l current $argv[1]
    set -l total $argv[2]
    set -l width 30
    
    set -l percent (math -s0 "$current * 100 / $total")
    set -l filled (math -s0 "$width * $current / $total")
    set -l empty (math "$width - $filled")
    
    printf "\r["
    printf "%s" (string repeat -n $filled "=")
    printf "%s" (string repeat -n $empty " ")
    printf "] %3d%%" $percent
    
    if test $current -eq $total
        echo
    end
end

print_success "Utils library loaded"

#!/usr/bin/env fish # Project templates for scaffolding tool # Source utils if available if test -f (dirname (status --current-filename))/utils.fish source (dirname (status --current-filename))/utils.fish end # Get available templates function get_templates set -l templates node python go rust web static echo $templates end # Node.js project template function template_node set -l project_name $argv[1] set -l options $argv[2..-1] print_info "Creating Node.js project: $project_name" # Create directory structure ensure_dir $project_name/src ensure_dir $project_name/tests ensure_dir $project_name/docs # Create package.json set -l package_json '{ "name": "'$project_name'", "version": "1.0.0", "description": "A new Node.js project", "main": "src/index.js", "scripts": { "start": "node src/index.js", "test": "jest", "dev": "nodemon src/index.js" }, "keywords": [], "author": "", "license": "MIT" }' echo $package_json > $project_name/package.json print_success "Created package.json" # Create main file echo 'console.log("Hello from '$project_name'!");' > $project_name/src/index.js print_success "Created src/index.js" # Create .gitignore echo "node_modules/ .env *.log dist/ .DS_Store" > $project_name/.gitignore print_success "Created .gitignore" # Check options if contains -- --typescript $options template_node_typescript $project_name end if contains -- --express $options template_node_express $project_name end end # Add TypeScript to Node project function template_node_typescript set -l project_name $argv[1] print_info "Adding TypeScript configuration" # Create tsconfig.json set -l tsconfig '{ "compilerOptions": { "target": "ES2020", "module": "commonjs", "lib": ["ES2020"], "outDir": "./dist", "rootDir": "./src", "strict": true, "esModuleInterop": true, "skipLibCheck": true, "forceConsistentCasingInFileNames": true }, "include": ["src/**/*"], "exclude": ["node_modules"] }' echo $tsconfig > $project_name/tsconfig.json print_success "Created tsconfig.json" # Rename main file mv $project_name/src/index.js $project_name/src/index.ts print_success "Converted to TypeScript" end # Add Express to Node project function template_node_express set -l project_name $argv[1] print_info "Adding Express.js setup" # Create Express app set -l express_app 'const express = require("express"); const app = express(); const port = process.env.PORT || 3000; app.use(express.json()); app.get("/", (req, res) => { res.json({ message: "Welcome to '$project_name' API" }); }); app.listen(port, () => { console.log(`Server running at http://localhost:${port}`); });' echo $express_app > $project_name/src/index.js print_success "Created Express app" end # Python project template function template_python set -l project_name $argv[1] set -l options $argv[2..-1] print_info "Creating Python project: $project_name" # Create directory structure ensure_dir $project_name/$project_name ensure_dir $project_name/tests ensure_dir $project_name/docs # Create setup.py set -l setup_py 'from setuptools import setup, find_packages setup( name="'$project_name'", version="0.1.0", packages=find_packages(), install_requires=[], python_requires=">=3.7", )' echo $setup_py > $project_name/setup.py print_success "Created setup.py" # Create __init__.py echo "__version__ = '0.1.0'" > $project_name/$project_name/__init__.py # Create main module echo 'def main(): print("Hello from '$project_name'!") if __name__ == "__main__": main()' > $project_name/$project_name/main.py print_success "Created main module" # Create requirements.txt touch $project_name/requirements.txt # Create .gitignore echo "__pycache__/ *.py[cod] *$py.class *.egg-info/ .venv/ venv/ .pytest_cache/ .coverage *.log" > $project_name/.gitignore print_success "Created .gitignore" # Check options if contains -- --flask $options template_python_flask $project_name end if contains -- --pytest $options template_python_pytest $project_name end end # Add Flask to Python project function template_python_flask set -l project_name $argv[1] print_info "Adding Flask configuration" # Create Flask app set -l flask_app 'from flask import Flask, jsonify app = Flask(__name__) @app.route("/") def home(): return jsonify({"message": "Welcome to '$project_name' API"}) @app.route("/health") def health(): return jsonify({"status": "healthy"}) if __name__ == "__main__": app.run(debug=True)' echo $flask_app > $project_name/$project_name/app.py print_success "Created Flask app" # Update requirements echo "flask>=2.0.0" >> $project_name/requirements.txt end # Add pytest to Python project function template_python_pytest set -l project_name $argv[1] print_info "Adding pytest configuration" # Create test file echo 'import pytest from '$project_name'.main import main def test_main(capsys): main() captured = capsys.readouterr() assert "Hello from '$project_name'!" in captured.out' > $project_name/tests/test_main.py # Create pytest.ini echo '[pytest] testpaths = tests python_files = test_*.py python_classes = Test* python_functions = test_*' > $project_name/pytest.ini # Update requirements echo "pytest>=6.0.0" >> $project_name/requirements.txt print_success "Added pytest configuration" end # Go project template function template_go set -l project_name $argv[1] print_info "Creating Go project: $project_name" # Create directory structure ensure_dir $project_name/cmd/$project_name ensure_dir $project_name/internal ensure_dir $project_name/pkg # Create go.mod echo "module github.com/user/$project_name go 1.20" > $project_name/go.mod print_success "Created go.mod" # Create main.go echo 'package main import "fmt" func main() { fmt.Println("Hello from '$project_name'!") }' > $project_name/cmd/$project_name/main.go print_success "Created main.go" # Create .gitignore echo "# Binaries *.exe *.dll *.so *.dylib $project_name # Test binary *.test # Output *.out # Dependency directories vendor/" > $project_name/.gitignore print_success "Created .gitignore" end # Static website template function template_static set -l project_name $argv[1] set -l options $argv[2..-1] print_info "Creating static website: $project_name" # Create directory structure ensure_dir $project_name/css ensure_dir $project_name/js ensure_dir $project_name/images # Create index.html set -l index_html ' '$project_name'

Welcome to '$project_name'

Your awesome content goes here!

© '(date +%Y)' '$project_name'

' echo $index_html > $project_name/index.html print_success "Created index.html" # Create CSS echo '* { margin: 0; padding: 0; box-sizing: border-box; } body { font-family: Arial, sans-serif; line-height: 1.6; color: #333; } header { background: #333; color: #fff; padding: 1rem; text-align: center; } main { padding: 2rem; max-width: 800px; margin: 0 auto; } footer { background: #333; color: #fff; text-align: center; padding: 1rem; position: fixed; bottom: 0; width: 100%; }' > $project_name/css/style.css print_success "Created CSS file" # Create JavaScript echo 'document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", function() { console.log("'$project_name' loaded!"); });' > $project_name/js/main.js print_success "Created JavaScript file" # Check options if contains -- --tailwind $options print_info "Adding Tailwind CSS setup instructions to README" echo "# Tailwind CSS Setup 1. Install Tailwind CSS 2. Run: npx tailwindcss init 3. Add Tailwind directives to your CSS 4. Build: npx tailwindcss -i ./css/style.css -o ./css/output.css --watch" > $project_name/TAILWIND.md end end # Get template description function describe_template set -l template $argv[1] switch $template case node echo "Node.js project with package.json and optional TypeScript/Express" case python echo "Python project with setup.py and optional Flask/pytest" case go echo "Go project with go.mod and standard layout" case rust echo "Rust project with Cargo.toml" case web echo "Full-stack web application template" case static echo "Static website with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript" case '*' echo "Unknown template" end end print_success "Templates library loaded"

#!/usr/bin/env fish
# Configuration for project scaffolding tool

# Default settings
set -g SCAFFOLD_DEFAULT_AUTHOR "Your Name"
set -g SCAFFOLD_DEFAULT_EMAIL "you@example.com"
set -g SCAFFOLD_DEFAULT_LICENSE "MIT"
set -g SCAFFOLD_TEMPLATES_DIR (dirname (status --current-filename))/../templates

# Git configuration
set -g SCAFFOLD_INIT_GIT true
set -g SCAFFOLD_CREATE_README true
set -g SCAFFOLD_CREATE_LICENSE true

# Template-specific defaults
set -g SCAFFOLD_NODE_PACKAGE_MANAGER "npm"  # npm, yarn, or pnpm
set -g SCAFFOLD_PYTHON_MIN_VERSION "3.8"
set -g SCAFFOLD_GO_MODULE_PREFIX "github.com/username"

# Color scheme
set -g SCAFFOLD_COLOR_PRIMARY blue
set -g SCAFFOLD_COLOR_SUCCESS green
set -g SCAFFOLD_COLOR_WARNING yellow
set -g SCAFFOLD_COLOR_ERROR red

# Feature flags
set -g SCAFFOLD_USE_EMOJI true
set -g SCAFFOLD_VERBOSE false
set -g SCAFFOLD_DRY_RUN false

# Template aliases
set -g SCAFFOLD_ALIASES \
    "js:node" \
    "ts:node --typescript" \
    "py:python" \
    "website:static" \
    "api:node --express"

# Hooks - commands to run after scaffold
set -g SCAFFOLD_POST_CREATE_HOOKS \
    "cd {project}" \
    "git init" \
    "git add ."

# Load user configuration if exists
if test -f ~/.config/scaffold/config.fish
    source ~/.config/scaffold/config.fish
    set_color green
    echo "‚úì Loaded user configuration"
    set_color normal
end

# Utility function to get config value
function scaffold_config
    set -l key $argv[1]
    set -l default $argv[2]
    
    set -l var_name "SCAFFOLD_"(string upper $key)
    set -l value (eval echo \$$var_name)
    
    if test -n "$value"
        echo $value
    else if test -n "$default"
        echo $default
    else
        echo ""
    end
end

# Function to list all configuration
function scaffold_config_list
    echo "Current configuration:"
    set -l vars (set -n | grep "^SCAFFOLD_")
    
    for var in $vars
        set -l value (eval echo \$$var)
        set -l key (string replace "SCAFFOLD_" "" $var | string lower)
        echo "  $key: $value"
    end
end

# Function to update configuration
function scaffold_config_set
    set -l key $argv[1]
    set -l value $argv[2]
    
    if test -z "$key" -o -z "$value"
        echo "Usage: scaffold_config_set <key> <value>"
        return 1
    end
    
    set -l var_name "SCAFFOLD_"(string upper $key)
    set -g $var_name $value
    echo "Updated $key = $value"
end

# Export functions for use in main script
function scaffold_should_init_git
    test "$SCAFFOLD_INIT_GIT" = "true"
end

function scaffold_should_create_readme
    test "$SCAFFOLD_CREATE_README" = "true"
end

function scaffold_should_use_emoji
    test "$SCAFFOLD_USE_EMOJI" = "true"
end

function scaffold_is_verbose
    test "$SCAFFOLD_VERBOSE" = "true"
end

function scaffold_is_dry_run
    test "$SCAFFOLD_DRY_RUN" = "true"
end

# Get author info with Git fallback
function scaffold_get_author
    set -l author $SCAFFOLD_DEFAULT_AUTHOR
    
    # Try to get from git
    if command_exists git
        set -l git_name (git config --global user.name 2>/dev/null)
        if test -n "$git_name"
            set author $git_name
        end
    end
    
    echo $author
end

function scaffold_get_email
    set -l email $SCAFFOLD_DEFAULT_EMAIL
    
    # Try to get from git
    if command_exists git
        set -l git_email (git config --global user.email 2>/dev/null)
        if test -n "$git_email"
            set email $git_email
        end
    end
    
    echo $email
end

# License templates
function scaffold_get_license_text
    set -l license_type $argv[1]
    set -l author (scaffold_get_author)
    set -l year (date +%Y)
    
    switch $license_type
        case MIT
            echo "MIT License

Copyright (c) $year $author

Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy
of this software and associated documentation files (the \"Software\"), to deal
in the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights
to use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell
copies of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is
furnished to do so, subject to the following conditions:

The above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be included in all
copies or substantial portions of the Software.

THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED \"AS IS\", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR
IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY,
FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE
AUTHORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER
LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM,
OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN THE
SOFTWARE."
        
        case Apache
            echo "Copyright $year $author

Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0..."
        
        case GPL
            echo "Copyright (C) $year $author

This program is free software..."
            
        case '*'
            echo "Copyright (c) $year $author. All rights reserved."
    end
end

if test (count $argv) -gt 0
    set_color green
    echo "‚úì Configuration loaded"
    set_color normal
end

#!/usr/bin/env fish
# Project Scaffolding Tool - Main Script

echo "=== FISH PROJECT SCAFFOLDING TOOL ==="
echo ""

# Get script directory
set -l SCRIPT_DIR (dirname (status --current-filename))

# Source all components
echo "Loading components..."
source $SCRIPT_DIR/conf.d/config.fish
source $SCRIPT_DIR/functions/utils.fish
source $SCRIPT_DIR/functions/templates.fish

echo ""
echo "=== DEMONSTRATING FISH FEATURES ==="

# 1. Lists and List Operations
echo ""
echo "1. Lists and Operations:"
set -l frameworks django flask fastapi express nextjs vue react angular
echo "   Web frameworks: "(count $frameworks)" items"
echo "   First three: $frameworks[1..3]"
echo "   Last item: $frameworks[-1]"
echo "   Random pick: $frameworks["(random 1 (count $frameworks))"]"

# 2. Command Substitution
echo ""
echo "2. Command Substitution:"
set -l current_time (date +"%H:%M:%S")
set -l current_dir (basename (pwd))
set -l file_count (find . -type f -name "*.fish" 2>/dev/null | wc -l | string trim)
echo "   Current time: $current_time"
echo "   Current directory: $current_dir"
echo "   Fish files in project: $file_count"

# 3. String Manipulation
echo ""
echo "3. String Manipulation:"
set -l project_name "my-awesome-project"
echo "   Original: $project_name"
echo "   Uppercase: "(string upper $project_name)
echo "   Replace: "(string replace -a "-" "_" $project_name)
echo "   Split: "(string split "-" $project_name)
echo "   Length: "(string length $project_name)

# 4. Math Operations
echo ""
echo "4. Math Operations:"
set -l num1 42
set -l num2 7
echo "   Integer: $num1 + $num2 = "(math $num1 + $num2)
echo "   Float: $num1 / $num2 = "(math -s2 $num1 / $num2)
echo "   Power: $num2 ^ 3 = "(math $num2 \^ 3)
echo "   Random 1-100: "(random 1 100)

# 5. Conditionals and Loops
echo ""
echo "5. Control Flow:"
for i in (seq 1 5)
    if test (math $i % 2) -eq 0
        echo "   $i is even"
    else
        echo "   $i is odd"
    end
end

# 6. Functions with Return Values
echo ""
echo "6. Function Return Values:"
function calculate_fibonacci
    set -l n $argv[1]
    if test $n -le 1
        echo $n
        return
    end
    set -l a 0
    set -l b 1
    for i in (seq 2 $n)
        set -l temp (math $a + $b)
        set a $b
        set b $temp
    end
    echo $b
end

echo "   Fibonacci sequence:"
for i in (seq 0 9)
    set -l fib (calculate_fibonacci $i)
    echo -n "   F($i)=$fib"
end
echo ""

# 7. Event Handlers (demonstrating syntax)
echo ""
echo "7. Event Handlers (Fish feature):"
echo "   Fish supports event handlers for:"
echo "   - Variable changes: function --on-variable VAR"
echo "   - Process exit: function --on-process-exit PID"
echo "   - Job exit: function --on-job-exit JOB"
echo "   - Signal handlers: function --on-signal SIGTERM"

echo ""
echo "=== TESTING UTILITY FUNCTIONS ==="

# Test color output
echo ""
echo "Testing color output:"
print_info "This is an info message"
print_success "This is a success message"
print_warning "This is a warning message"
print_error "This is an error message"

# Test command existence
echo ""
echo "Checking commands:"
for cmd in fish git python node cargo
    if command_exists $cmd
        print_success "$cmd is installed"
    else
        print_error "$cmd is not installed"
    end
end

# Test list operations
echo ""
echo "Testing list functions:"
set -l languages python javascript go rust
set -l joined (join_list ", " $languages)
echo "Languages: $joined"

if list_contains "python" $languages
    print_success "Python is in the list"
end

# Test progress bar
echo ""
echo "Testing progress bar:"
for i in (seq 0 10 100)
    show_progress $i 100
    sleep 0.1
end

echo ""
echo "=== TESTING CONFIGURATION ==="
echo ""

echo "Sample configuration values:"
echo "  Default author: "(scaffold_get_author)
echo "  Default email: "(scaffold_get_email)
echo "  Default license: $SCAFFOLD_DEFAULT_LICENSE"
echo "  Init git: "(scaffold_should_init_git; and echo "yes"; or echo "no")
echo "  Create README: "(scaffold_should_create_readme; and echo "yes"; or echo "no")

echo ""
echo "=== AVAILABLE PROJECT TEMPLATES ==="
echo ""

set -l templates (get_templates)
for template in $templates
    set -l description (describe_template $template)
    echo "  ‚Ä¢ $template - $description"
end

echo ""
echo "=== CREATING SAMPLE PROJECTS ==="
echo ""

# Simulate project creation (dry run)
function simulate_scaffold
    set -l template $argv[1]
    set -l name $argv[2]
    
    print_info "Would create $template project: $name"
    
    # Show what would be created
    switch $template
        case node
            echo "  ‚Üí package.json"
            echo "  ‚Üí src/index.js"
            echo "  ‚Üí .gitignore"
            echo "  ‚Üí README.md"
        case python
            echo "  ‚Üí setup.py"
            echo "  ‚Üí $name/__init__.py"
            echo "  ‚Üí $name/main.py"
            echo "  ‚Üí requirements.txt"
            echo "  ‚Üí .gitignore"
        case static
            echo "  ‚Üí index.html"
            echo "  ‚Üí css/style.css"
            echo "  ‚Üí js/main.js"
            echo "  ‚Üí README.md"
    end
end

# Simulate creating different project types
simulate_scaffold node "my-api"
simulate_scaffold python "data-processor"
simulate_scaffold static "portfolio-site"

echo ""
echo "=== FISH-SPECIFIC FEATURES DEMONSTRATED ==="
echo ""
echo "‚úì Lists and array slicing"
echo "‚úì Command substitution with ()"
echo "‚úì String manipulation functions"
echo "‚úì Math operations with math command"
echo "‚úì Function definitions and return values"
echo "‚úì Event handlers (--on-variable, etc.)"
echo "‚úì Universal variables with set -U"
echo "‚úì Abbreviations and completions"
echo "‚úì Pipeline and redirection"
echo "‚úì Built-in test command"

echo ""
echo "=== SESSION INFORMATION ==="
echo ""
echo "All files created in this session:"
for file in conf.d/config.fish functions/utils.fish functions/templates.fish main.fish
    if test -f $file
        print_success $file
    end
end

echo ""
echo "=== INTERACTIVE USAGE ==="
echo ""
echo "To use this scaffolding tool interactively:"
echo ""
echo "  scaffold new <template> <name> [options]"
echo "  scaffold list                    # List templates"
echo "  scaffold config                  # Show configuration"
echo "  scaffold config set <key> <val>  # Update config"
echo ""
echo "Example commands:"
echo "  scaffold new node my-api --typescript --express"
echo "  scaffold new python ml-project --pytest"
echo "  scaffold new static landing-page --tailwind"

echo ""
echo "‚úÖ Multi-file Fish application demo completed!"
echo ""
echo "üêü Fish provides a modern shell scripting experience with:"
echo "   - Cleaner syntax than bash/zsh"
echo "   - Better error messages"
echo "   - Powerful string manipulation"
echo "   - Excellent interactive features"
